metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17833 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
OpenSLP releases in the 1.0.2 and 1.1.0 code streams have a heap-related memory corruption issue which may manifest itself as a denial-of-service or a remote code-execution vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17833` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libslp1 - 1.2.1-11ubuntu0.16.04.1
slpd - 1.2.1-11ubuntu0.16.04.1
slptool - 1.2.1-11ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> Fix may not be complete mdeslaur> patch need to also be added a few lines below

criterions.comment: openslp-dfsg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.1-11ubuntu0.16.04.1').
